app.name: Build Tools Performance Benchmark
app.one_liner: A benchmarking tool that compares JavaScript bundlers and build tools across key performance metrics like startup time, build speed, memory usage, and bundle size.

screens.name: Benchmark Dashboard
screens.purpose: Display side-by-side performance metrics for multiple build tools under consistent test conditions.
primary_actions: Analyze memory usage and bundle sizes

rust_commands.name: run_benchmark
rust_commands.purpose: Execute a standardized benchmark suite against configured build tools and collect performance metrics.

mvp_plan: week 1: Implement metric collection for startup, HMR, build, memory, and bundle size
week 1: Integrate support for Rspack, Rsbuild, Vite, webpack, Farm, and Parcel
acceptance_tests: The system must display startup time (no cache) for all supported build tools using a consistent React app with 1,000 components.
The system must report HMR latency after a module change under identical test conditions for each tool.
